授業目的: <Reading> The purpose of the EC4 Reading course is to build on students' intensive and extensive reading skills by reading about a variety of policy topics of different genres.<Presentation> The purpose of the EC4 Presentation course is to develop group presentation skills to describe a social problem and suggest possible solutions with secondary data support.   <Seminar> The purpose of the EC4 Seminar course is to develop students' academic discussion skills focusing on social issues. < Writing＞ The purpose of the EC4 Writing course is to continue to develop the academic writing skills learned in EC3 Writing.
到達目標: <Reading> Students will be able to: 1) increase their ability to comprehend academic and current events-related texts 2) expand their knowledge of vocabulary 3) improve their reading speed and fluency and 4) strengthen their critical, analytical reading skills.<Presentation> Students will be able to use a variety of presentation language to coherently guide the audience through their presentation and describe their data and central arguments. Students will be able to create effective visual aids and source reliable data.<Seminar> Students will be able to : 1) improve vocabulary, 2) use discussion questions and skills to naturally participate in a discussion 3) evaluate information on the web. <Writing> Students review the paragraph writing skills from EC3 Writing, and develop essays with introductions and conclusions. They will also learn about supporting their opinions with facts and use an outside source in their essays. Students also develop and put to practice their understanding of the writing process.
特記事項: 【合併】English Communication IV　Ａ（総合政策学部）/英語コミュニケーションIV　Ａ（総合政策学部）
授業方法: Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English. Course materials will be available to students through LUNA.

トピック.授業計画1:
*All 14 classes will be conducted face-to-face.
 <Reading> Students practice reading skills and read and discuss a variety of policy-related texts in English. 
<Presentation>Students will improve their ability to give a presentation in English confidently and comfortably over the course of three presentations. For each presentation, students will concentrate on several aspects of public speaking while using and improving on the practiced skills before.
<Seminar> Students will develop an ability to discuss a topic with a group. The topics will challenge students to think beyond their experiences and cultural influences.
<Writing> Students will complete essays that include introductions, outside sources, and conclusions. In addition, students will also complete tasks that improve fluency and understanding of the writing process.
トピック.授業外学習2:
<Reading> Students read short articles, and complete language development activities. They read for fluency and speed on XReading.
<Presentation> Students will be required to work individually or as a group to prepare and practice their presentations and to do self reflections after the presentations have been completed.
<Seminar> Students read articles and discuss them in class. Students learn vocabulary using Quizlet and the articles, ask discussion questions, and use discussion skills. Students find information on the Internet evaluate it.
<Writing> Students complete writing activities, study model essays, and apply their understanding of the writing process by planning and drafting essays. They are also required to revise their essay assignments based on teacher feedback. They also complete homework tasks to practise skills and revise their essays.
